awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for the 2022 ACM SIGCOMM Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
This is a travel grant for ACM SIGCOMM 2022 conference.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
This proposal provided funding to support US-based graduate students to attend the SIGCOMM 2022 conference in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Attending conferences such as SIGCOMM is a critical experience for graduate students since it exposes them to new ideas and helps them build a network with other researchers. The goal of this funding is to broaden the audience attending this premier network protocol conference and as a result, raise the level of interaction and the potential for new collaborations, new investigations, and high-quality research.  By supporting graduate students to attend SIGCOMM 2022, the grant specified in this proposal will increase the dissemination of the conference research results to a larger and a more diverse audience, which otherwise would not have been able to attend.

Funding was provided to 15 US-based students, allowing them to attend the ACM SIGCOMM conference in Netherlands and meet other researchers from both industry and academia. Students were selected based on a rubric that scored students for 1) diversity status, 2) author status, 3) persuasiveness of the student and advisor letters. All awards were made in the amount of $1500 (or less if actual expenses were lower). 

SIGCOMM 2022 included technical sessions broadly covering the field of networking. This high-quality technical program taught grant recipients about cutting edge research.

 

 


Last Modified: 07/02/2024
Modified by: Chen Qian
